data.title: Five Larenz Tate Films That Gives You The Vapors
data.meta_description: The legendary actor is celebrating his 48th birthday today.
data.text:
The legendary actor is celebrating his 48th birthday today.

By BET Staff

As we celebrate Larenz Tate's 48th birthday today (September 8), it's the perfect time to highlight some of his most memorable films that have left audiences swooning. Whether it's romance, comedy, drama, or action, Tate has delivered outstanding performances, making him a beloved figure in film.

Here are five Larenz Tate films that will give you "the vapors."

Love Jones (1997)

In this timeless classic, Larenz Tate stars as Darius Lovehall, a poet who falls head over heels for Nina Mosley, played by Nia Long. Their electric chemistry and poetic courtship have made "Love Jones" a classic romantic drama and Tate's swag as Lovehall is downright legendary.

Girls Trip (2017)

In "Girls Trip," Larenz Tate plays Julian Stevens, an entrepreneur entangled with Regina Hall's character during an unforgettable weekend in New Orleans. His charming and charismatic performance adds a layer of allure to this funny comedy.

The Inkwell (1994)

"The Inkwell" offers a change of pace from Tate's more intense roles. He stars as Drew, a young man navigating the complexities of family, love, and personal growth during a summer vacation in Martha's Vineyard. The film showcases Tate's versatility as an actor in a lighthearted, heartwarming setting while still maintaining his sexy.

Biker Boyz (2003)

Larenz Tate takes on the role of Wood in this high-octane drama centered around underground motorcycle racing. With an all-star cast that included Lisa Bonet, Derek Luke, and Laurence Fishburne, Tate was flexing his sexy.

Why Do Fools Fall in Love (1998)

In this biographical drama, Tate shines as 1950s singer Frankie Lymon, whose life fell into shambles after he became famous. His portrayal of the iconic musician's tumultuous life and relationships is compelling and emotionally charged, reminding us he is not just a sex symbol but an excellent actor.

Happy birthday, Larenz Tate!
